name: hCard Widget for WordPress
author: michaellautman

sections.description:
Give your local SEO efforts a boost!

This plugin creates two new widgets that outputs contact information (URL, address, email, phone) according to the hCard microformat standard and Schema.org

In addition, each field can be assigned a unique CSS class for styling.

Visit the support forum on our site for help.

Available Fields

  • Widget Title

  • Name (Given, Middle, Family)

  • Organization

  • Address

  • Website

  • Email

  • Map (Organizations only – for now)

  • Telephone

  • Fax

  • Google Plus (rel=”author” for individuals and rel=”publisher” for organizations)

  • Facebook

  • Twitter

  • LinkedIn

Notes

This plugin was built on the amazing Piklist using the [Piklist Plugin Builder] (https://github.com/michaellautman/Piklist-Plugin-Builder).
sections.installation:
Method 1

  1. In your WordPress installation, go to Plugins->Add New.

  2. In the search box, type ‘hCard Widget’.

  3. Install and activate.

Method 2

  1. Download the plugin.

  2. In your WordPress installation, navigate to Plugins->Add New->Upload

  3. Choose \’hcard-widget.zip\’ from your computer

Method 3

  1. Download the plugin.

  2. Extract the folder

  3. Using your favourite FTP client, upload the folder \’hcard-widget\’ to \’/wp-content/plugins\’ on your server

  4. In your WordPress installation, navigate to Plugins->Installed Plugins and activate hCard Widget.
sections.changelog:
2.2.2

Updated Piklist checker. Updated compatibility to 4.6.1

2.2.1

Updated compatibility to 4.3.1

2.1.2

Minor upgrades. Small changes to admin page, included icons for plugin installer.

2.0

Complete overhaul of the plugin. The plugin now requires Piklist.

short_description: Creates a widget that outputs contact information for individuals or organizations with Schema.org compliant markup.
